resources.string: Directions were sent to your email
"Canvas is too large. Actual size will be %1$d x %2$d."
"Canvas is too large. Upgrade to Pro for larger canvas sizes. Actual size will be %1$d x %2$d."
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device."
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device."
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
Verify your email address to participate in the Community.
Erases all the contents of the layer.
Removes the entire layer from the layer stack.
Creates an exact duplicate of the layer above the current layer. If duplicating a layer group, the entire group and all the layers in the group are duplicated.
Combines the current layer with the layer below it and removes the current layer. !:May result in visual changes on the layer stack, especially when the layer uses a non-Normal blending mode.
Current mode: Repeat all. Toggle repeat mode.
Current mode: Repeat none. Toggle repeat mode.
Current mode: Repeat one. Toggle repeat mode.
File was imported as a new project.
A Bluetooth device for capturing colors in the real world
A fast ImageView (and Drawable) that supports rounded corners (and ovals or circles) based on the original example from Romain Guy.
This is the HSB Brightness shift.
More natural lightness adjustment than Brightness.
Adjusts the gamma of the image.
This is the HSB Hue shift.
This is the HSB Saturation shift.
Increases saturation of dull colors while leaving already saturated colors intact.
Allows you to compare the effect of the effect with the original artwork.
Current brush head source bitmap (if selected).
Enter the name for your new brush or leave the default name.
Presets of settings for the new brush.
Shows the brush texture bitmap if one has been selected.
Imports a new bitmap to the brush head library.
Controls how subsequent “stamps” of the brush head are interacting with each other along the stroke.
List of brushes in current brush folder.
Panel with brush opacity, flow and softness controls.
Controls direction of the brush size increase, relative to the tip of the stylus.
Utilize the full color information from the head source bitmap. If turned off, only the grayscale channel of the bitmap will be used.
Adjusts the amount of color used from the source brush head bitmap.
Interprets the brush head’s transparency as a three-dimensional height map.
Pressure, Velocity and Tilt controls for brush depth.
Controls the rate of flow of the “pigment” from the brush tip.
Pressure, Velocity and Tilt controls for brush flow.
The amount of randomness applied to flow of the brush along the stroke.
Brush flow variations along the length of the stroke.
" If highlighted, indicates that brush flow is assigned to opacity virtual slider on main toolbar. "
Uses negative of the source bitmap.
Controls of the amount of randomness of the brush head placement.
Lets you adjust the tonal curve of the source bitmap.
Basic angle of the brush head bitmap relative to the stroke direction.
The amount of randomness in brush head angle applied along the stroke.
The amount of randomness in brush head angle at the beginning of each stroke.
Angle of the brush head relative to the direction of the stroke.
If active, the initial angle of the brush head is kept relative to the screen, not to the canvas.
With a tilt-sensitive stylus, stylus angle is used to control the brush head angle.
Pressure, Velocity and Tilt controls for brush scatter.
The amount of randomness applied to brush head position at each point of the stroke.
Blurs the brush head, adding softness to the strokes.
" If highlighted, indicates that brush softness is assigned to opacity virtual slider on main toolbar. "
Removes current source bitmap from the brush.
Controls density of brush head “stamps” along the stroke.
Averages out the colors coming onto the brush head when blending, mixing-in or diluting.
Multiplies with the Flow in the head setting specifically when blending.
Defines the length that the paint is smudged (the pull).
If on, in Blend mode the brush will sample colors from current layer and all visible layers below it.
Randomly changes brightness along the stroke.
Randomly changes brightness at the beginning of each stroke.
Randomly changes hue along the stroke.
Randomly changes hue at the beginning of each stroke.
Randomly changes saturation along the stroke.
Randomly changes saturation at the beginning of each stroke.
Pressure, Velocity and Tilt controls for brush dilution.
Controls how much the brush picks up the underlying colors without replacing the current color on the brush.
Controls how much the brush picks up the underlying colors and replaces the current color on the brush.
When on, the paint is treated as wet and will move around transparency as well as color.
Controls how the brush applies and blends colors.
For fill brushes: if active, displays the fill of the brush in real time; otherwise the stroke area will be filled only after the stroke is finished.
Special effects applied to the brush.
Apply a filter or color adjustment to the brush.
Removes current effect from the brush.
Controls the main parameter of current effect.
Controls the number of attractors in each stroke.
Particles are pulled toward their attractor so this defines how much they can overshoot their attractor.
Controls the number of particles assigned to the attractors.
The distance the attractors are set away from the stroke path.
Defines the size of the particle in relation to the size of the brush.
The angle of the snapping grid.
Scales the brush size in relation to the grid size.
Defines the size of the snapping grid in pixels.
Turns on the screentone effects of current brush.
Controls special effects added to the brush, from watercolor effects to photographic filters.
Controls the amount of spreading of the stroke color.
Controls how fast the watercolor spreading fades out.
Here it works as amount of water in real watercolors.
Controls how the stroke interacts with underlying colors.
Turns on the watercolor effects of current brush.
Shows current blending mode of the brush.
Prevents the build-up of the color with subsequent overlapping strokes.
" List of brush blending modes. The blending mode determines how the paint color on the brush interacts with existing colors of the active layer. "
Adjusts how much the blending mode affects the brush appearance.
" Defines how much paint it needs to build up before being applied to the canvas. "
Adjusts general opacity of the brush stroke.
" If highlighted, indicates that brush opacity is assigned to opacity virtual slider on main toolbar. "
" Controls wet edges effect. The edges of the stroke will be more opaque than the rest of it. "
Master size adjustment of current brush.
Pressure, Velocity and Tilt controls for brush size.
Amount of randomness applied to the brush size along the stroke.
Brush size variations along the length of the stroke.
Smooths the path of the brush stroke. Acts like a brush stabilizer.
Controls the behavior of the brush along the path of the stroke.
Rotates the texture relative to brush head.
Rotates brush texture randomly along the stroke.
" If active, the brush uses color from the brush texture bitmap. This interferes with the current painting color. "
Adjusts how much color is taken from the texture source bitmap.
Controls how much the texture affects the application of color.
Curves controlling dynamic behavior for the brush texture Depth parameter.
Defines a falloff of the texture effect from the brush’s tip to the back of the brush when tilting.
Inverts luminosity of texture source bitmap.
Adjusts tonal relationships of the source bitmap.
Places brush texture in random positions at each point of the stroke.
Places brush texture in random position at the beginning of the stroke.
Controls the placement of the texture along the brush stroke.
Changes brush texture size randomly along the stroke.
Changes brush texture size randomly along the stroke.
Scales texture to current brush size at each point of the stroke.
Scale brush texture with brush size
Applies blur to the texture bitmap.
Removes current source bitmap from the brush.
Allows to stretch the texture along the axis of the stroke.
Adds impasto effect but for brush texture only.
Panel with brush size, angle and blending mode controls.
Gives you access to your collection of brushes.
Indicates that there are hidden brush folders.
Zooms the view so your canvas fills the entire screen.
Locks current magnification and rotation of the canvas.
Opens a floating window with the thumbnail view of the canvas.
Turns the Canvas Preview to grayscale.
Removes unnecessary outer areas of the canvas.
Adds a layer with editable grid of comics-style panels.
Resizes or permanently crops the canvas.
Helps correct geometry of the project.
Adjusts the Blur parameter of the current brush.
Adjusts the Pull parameter of the current brush.
Select one of three cloning modes.
If on, the source and target points are aligned (in constant relative distance) between strokes.
If on, the source and target points may be in separate places. If off, the tool clones from the position of the brush tip (but the source may be on another layer).
Generates more or less contrast when approaching an edge on the source image.
Adjusts the length of the strokes generated by the Smart cloning.
Controls how fast the brush samples the underlying paint colors.
Controls how much the stroke rotates along the contours of the source image.
If on, it will track ahead and only draw the stroke if it is within a certain length and has ended.
Allows you to compare the effect of the effect with the original artwork.
Controls for the Tonal Curves tool.
Adds the current color at the end of the active palette.
The name of the active palette.
Options for the active swatch palette.
Shows current (right half) and previous (left half) colors.
Adjust the opacity of the color.
Switch between color wheel and color sliders.
Standard, hexadecimal equivalent of the RGB specification of the color.
Standard Red-Green-Blue color model; the actual system of color coding in the application.
A color picker in form of circular color graph representing a three-dimensional color space.
Allows you to compare the effect of the effect with the original artwork.
Preview of the canvas. Shows selected paper color and texture, and the imported image – if selected.
Confirm creation of the new project with current settings. The newly created project will be opened in the Studio.
Canvas dimensions for the new project.
Controls for the Paper (background) layer of the project.
Controls for on-screen proofing and gamma correction.
Controls for the timelapse recording of your project.
Indicates the type of new projet to be created.
New canvas with one empty layer to start with.
New project based on the selected imported image.
Shows current height of the cropping frame.
If on, keeps the width-to-height ratio constant.
Crop tool removes unnecessary outer areas of the canvas.
Shows current width of the cropping frame.
The curve diagram shows the relationship between the input values (like stylus pressure; on horizontal X axis) and output values (like resulting brush size; on vertical Y axis).
Shows points where you touch the screen.
Resolution of the canvas in dpi (pixels-per-inch).
When active, the ratio between width and height will be retained when entering new values.
Calculated number of layers that you could add to the project in current canvas size.
Displays the pixel resolution of the canvas.
Saves current canvas size settings as a new preset.
Add current size to custom sizes
Select the units for defining the size of your new canvas.
Collection of links to information sources, news and stories about Infinite Painter application and user community.
Quality of the exported JPEG file.
Hides the Paper layer from the export and preserves transparency of layers.
Saves the version history data with the exported project, so you could return to earlier saved versions.
Saves the timelapse recording data with the exported project.
Name of the file to be exported.
Adjust the size of the sampling area of the Eyedropper tool.
Cancels the current fill without closing the tool.
Confirms current fill without closing the tool.
Controls how much the fill will spread.
Current source for the fill sampling.
Fills area or selection with a color gradient.
Shows the current fill tool; allows you to switch to another fill tool.
Fill area or selection with a repetitive pattern.
Fills areas with flat, uniform color.
Black & White filter turns current layer into 8-bit grayscale image.
Bloom filter smartly emphasizes the brightest areas in the image.
Blur filter applies classic Gaussian blur to the image.
Bokeh filter adds the photographic bokeh effect to the image.
Dilate filter emphasizes the highlights similarly to the Bokeh filter.
Edges filter finds edges in the image and draws them in black on transparent background.
Emboss filter adds simulated depth to the image.
Erode filter widens the dark areas of the image.
Fade filter reduces the opacity of the current layer.
The Fisheye filter distorts geometry of the image simulating effect of the fisheye photo lens.
Gloom filter smartly darkens the brightest areas in the image.
Glow filter makes highlights of the image even brighter.
Edit the gradient of the current filter.
Gradient map filter maps a custom color gradient onto the grayscale component of the image.
Grain filter adds three kinds of random noise to the image.
Halftone filter consists of four different halftone filters.
Hexagons filter breaks the image into flat regular hexagons each filled with the average color of the original image in its area.
High-pass filter enhances details, thus sharpening the image.
A set of four filters inverting colors in various ways.
Kaleidoscope filter adds a complex kaleidoscopic effect to the image.
Lens flare filter adds a basic lens flare effect to the image.
Local contrast filter increases contrast of the image in areas of high detail and on edges.
Manga filter turns the current layer into a Manga-style image.
Indicates current mode (variant) of the current filter.
Monet filter stylizes your image into an impressionistic painting.
Direction filter adds directional blur to your image.
Spin filter adds radial blur to your image.
Zoom filter adds zoom blur to your image.
Allows you to compare the effect of the filter with the original artwork.
Paintbrush filter adds an oil painting appearance to your image.
Palette filter adds posterization effect to the image: reduces the number of colors in the image.
Pencil filter adds a pencil sketch appearance to your image.
" Pixelate filter breaks the image into a grid of square fields of uniform color. The color of each pixel is the average color of the original image in its area. "
Pop-art filter ads some pop art style to the image. Some color enhancement, some halftone overlays.
Scatter filter adds random displacements to the image.
Sepia filter turns the current layer into a sepia-colored grayscale image.
Sharpen filter enhances edges and details of the image.
Smooth filter removes noise and small details from the image.
Stained Glass filter breaks the image into irregular grid of flat-colored polygons.
Stamp filter turns the image into 1-bit (black-and-white) bitmap.
Stereo filter breaks the image into RGB channels and offsets each channel. The result simulates the vintage red-green stereo images.
Trace filter finds edges in the image and draws them in black over the original.
Adjusts the strength of current filter.
Van Gogh filter stylizes your image into another style of impressionistic painting.
" Warm filter adjusts photographic tint of the image. "
Gamma correction reduces increased contrast on overlapping semi-transparent colors.
If active, brush cursors will be displayed.
Calibration tools for pressure, velocity and tilt.
If active, if you hold your stylus at the end of a stroke, the stroke will be converted into an editable shape.
Reflects the gradient beyond its endpoints.
Repeats the gradient beyond its endpoints.
Reverses the direction of the gradient.
Number of repetitions of the gradient.
Helps in quick hatching without lifting your stylus or finger.
Helps drawing straight lines (parallel and perpendicular).
Path tool. Allows for creating precise guides in any shape.
One of two main workspaces in Painter: contains project management tools.
Creates a new layer containing merged copy of the layer group.
Merges all layers in the group to a single layer.
Removes the grouping of the layers leaving the layers intact.
Applies the mask to the layer. It permanently erases the masked-out areas and deletes the mask itself.
Fill the mask with 100% white so it fully reveals its layer.
Removes the mask from the layer.
Fills the layer mask with 100% black so it blocks out its layer completely.
Inverts the tonal values of the mask so masked out areas will be visible and vice-versa.
If engaged, all transformations apply to both the layer and the mask. If disengaged, the mask can be transformed separately.
"Makes a selection based on the mask's opacity."
"May be understood as the overall mask's opacity."
Indicates and toggles layer mask visibility.
Current color blending mode of the layer.
Erases all content of current layer and leaves the layer empty.
Clips (masks) current layer with the layer below.
Removes the entire layer and all of its content.
Creates an exact copy of current layer and place it above.
Ignores current layer in the timelapse video recording.
"Locks the transparency channel of current layer. This doesn't prevent from editing non-transparent areas of the layer."
Adds a mask to current layer.
Merges current layer with the one directly below.
Selects all non-transparent pixels of current layer (with interaction with existing selection mask).
Sets current layer as the source for the active tool.
Active layer visible; other layers dimmed.
Adds content of the layer to active selection (Boolean Add).
Finds areas not common in layer content and active selection (Boolean Difference).
Intersects content of the layer with active selection (Boolean Intersection).
Selects the content of the layer as a selection; combine the new selection with already active selection mask (if there is an active selection).
Replaces active selection with the content of the layer.
Subtracts the content of the layer from active selection (Boolean Subtract).
Subtracts existing selection from the content of the layer (Boolean Reverse subtract).
Adds a new, empty layer above the currently active layer.
Adds a new adjustment or filter layer from the list.
Creates a new layer group from currently active layer. You can add more layers to the group later.
The radius of the guide increases dynamically with the velocity (speed) of the stroke.
Controls the radius of the Lazy guide. This is the distance between your stylus/finger and the brush tip.
Displace and shape fragments of your artwork.
Rewind function lets you soften the deformation globally.
Twirl fragments of your artwork counterclockwise.
Twirl fragments of your artwork clockwise.
Toggle visibility of the Liquify grid under the cursor.
Adjust the size of the tool tip.
Your custom collection of favorite tools.
Tools for modifying and adjusting your artwork..
Saves and closes current project and returns to the Home workspace.
Shows layers in current project and offers tools for adding new layers and for layer-oriented functions.
Access to project handling, data exchange, settings and help.
Returns from the immersive mode to regular interface.
Settings for all currently active tools.
Indicates active Blend mode. The brush blends colors on canvas.
Opens the options panel for Blend mode.
Opens the options panel for Clone mode.
Main controls for brushwork modes, brushes and painting color.
Shows and controls strength of the effect of current brush.
Indicates Erase mode. The brush erases colors to transparency.
Indicates active Paint mode. The brush applies selected color.
Controls the size of current brush. The size of the icon shows relative brush size.
Reverses last brush stroke or action.
Control how the selection mask is shown.
Tool for precise adjusting tonal ranges.
Set of nine color and tonal adjustments.
The list of internal masking options.
Preset procedures that apply an effect to your artwork.
Liquify tool lets you precisely deform and distort your artwork.
Project handling, data exchange and help.
Lets you export current project for use in other applications, printing or sharing in social media.
Lets you import an image or an asset from outside.
Creates and open a new project; current project will be automatically saved and closed.
Lets you open an existing project from your Project Gallery; current project will be automatically saved and closed.
Lets you record a video showing your creative work in current project.
"Saves current current project. This will create a new 'state' in the project version history."
All the settings and options of the app.
Width of top and bottom edges of the frame.
Width of left and right edges of the frame.
Indicates the current color of the Paper layer.
Texture depth controls how much the texture affects brush strokes.
Texture opacity controls visual appearance of the texture.
Texture scale controls the size of the texture relative to canvas.
Color and texture of the Paper layer.
Change the appearance of the pattern.
Color adjustments for current Pattern fill.
Places set number of copies of the content of the active layer along a freehand path.
Set the amount of randomness to the angle of the copies.
Set the number of copies for the Path pattern.
Set the amount of randomness to the size of the copies.
Controls for the Path pattern tool.
Fills a set rectangular area with regular array of copies of a selected fragment.
Controls for the Quilt pattern tool.
Exports the pattern tile as PNG image.
Adjust the HSB Brightness of the colors in the pattern.
Adjust the contrast of the colors in the pattern.
Adjust the HSB Hue of the colors in the pattern.
Adjust the opacity of the pattern.
Adjust the HSB Saturation of the colors in the pattern.
Places set number of copies of the content of the active layer in a radial symmetry pattern.
Set the angular sector of the pattern.
Set number of planes for the symmetry pattern.
Adds a reflected copy of the pattern.
Controls for the Symmetry pattern tool.
Fills the active layer with rectangular pattern based on a selected rectangular fragment.
Controls for the Tile pattern tool.
Custom pattern tiles stored on your device.
Built-in pattern examples that come with the Painter installation.
1 Point perspective grid follows a basic perspective construction with only one vanishing point.
2 Point perspective grid uses two vanishing points. Vertical lines are parallel.
3 Point perspective grid uses the classic perspective construction with three vanishing points.
Curvilinear perspective uses multiple vanishing points and fish-eye, curved geometry.
Rectangular grid is a simple but versatile orthographic grid.
Isometric projection is based on three directions spaced 120°.
Indicates and toggles visibility of the grid lines.
Indicates and toggles the locking of the grid.
Resets the grid to the default configuration.
Indicates and toggles the snapping to the grid.
Toggles visibility of Paper layer in new project.
Aggregate length of all strokes made in current project.
The number of brush strokes made in the current project.
Calculated time spent editing current project.
Aggregate number of undo steps since beginning of the project.
Controls whether the timelapse video is going to be recorded in your project.
Creates a project based on an imported image.
Creates a new empty Pattern project.
Selected version and all earlier versions will be permanently deleted from the project.
A new project is created with selected version active and earlier versions in its history.
Gallery of your projects stored on this device.
All reference images stored in current project.
Remove the reference image from the project; original source of the image will not be affected.
Select color profile for on-screen color proofing.
Gamma correction reduces increased contrast on overlapping semi-transparent colors.
If on, resizes the content of the project; if off, crops or enlarges canvas only.
Shows current height of the cropping frame.
If on, keeps the width-to-height ratio constant.
Shows current width of the cropping frame.
Shows the current color of the mask overlay.
Controls the opacity of the mask overlay.
Shows the edge of selection mask as animated dashed line.
Shows the selection mask as a striped color overlay.
Creates a new brush using the content of current selection as its head.
Copies content of the selection to the Clipboard.
Creates a new layer containing a copy of selection content from all visible layers.
Erases the content of the selection on current layer.
Creates a new layer containing a copy of the selection content from current layer.
Cuts the content of the selection and places it on a new layer.
Regular transformation tools applied to the content of the selection.
Selects the area of the entire canvas.
Moves boundaries of the selection inwards.
Moves boundaries of the selection outwards.
Transforms only the mask, not the content.
Selection in form of editable circles and ellipses.
Selects a range of similar colors.
A list of selection tools. Shows current selection tool.
"Disables the Back button on the device which can sometimes be accidentally hit by one's palm when drawing."
"Specific functions that can be bound to the device's volume keys."
Specific function that can be bound to a double-tap gesture.
Specific function that can be bound to a longpress gesture.
Apply to all brushes on this device.
Select previous colors by tapping or sliding along the strip of colors.
If active, two separate Tools menus will be displayed; if off, one menu with two tabs will be used instead.
Dark or light color scheme for the interface.
Specific the language used by the app to communicate text information.
Turn on to have gamma correction applied.
Turn on if you want to see the prompt each time you close a project.
Adjust the number of history states to be saved with the project.
Specific functions that can be bound to the back button of your stylus.
Specific functions that can be bound to your finger when using a stylus.
Specific functions that can be bound to the front button of your stylus.
Turn off to prevent canvas rotation when zooming and panning with two-finger gestures.
If active, each time you change the active layer, new active layer will slightly blink.
Leaves a copy of the shape without leaving the shape editing mode.
Indicates current color for Solid Fill tool.
Controls for the Solid fill tool.
Reset all corrections to original state.
Basic, one-axis symmetry (pre-set to horizontal axis).
Mirrors the brush strokes against a number of axes.
Repeats brush strokes around the center point a number of times.
Limits the Radial symmetry to an angular sector.
If on, the brush strokes end on nearest symmetry axis.
Toggles the locking of current symmetry.
Adjust the number of symmetry planes.
Resets the center of current symmetry to default position.
Basic, one-axis symmetry (pre-set to vertical axis).
Import a new bitmap to the texture library.
Textures imported and stored in your device.
Built-in textures that come with Painter installation.
Delete all recorded timelapse video data.
Estimated duration of the video recording to be exported.
Export the recorded timelapse as a video file.
Shows how much storage the video recording occupies.
Actual frame size of the video recording.
If active, the timelapse recording will show zooming, panning and canvas rotation.
Toggles the recording of the timelapse video.
Opens a simple video player window with preview of your timelapse recording.
Applies and closes the current tool.
Cancels and closes the current tool.
Control what you see on screen.
A set of tools that apply to the entire project rather than to an active layer.
In Clone mode the brush applies a copy of existing artwork from different location.
Tools for filling areas with color, gradients or patterns.
Tools for modification of the existing artwork.
Pattern tools multiply fragments of your artwork, creating controlled repetitive patterns.
Tools to select fragments of the canvas for further editing.
A range of tools for geometric transformations.
Similar to the Basic mode with addition of repositionable anchor point.
Allows you to move, scale and rotate objects.
Flip content relative to center of the bounding box.
Leave a copy of transformation content without leaving the transformation workspace.
Allows you to transform the bounding box only.
Switch to clock mode for the time input.
Switch to text input mode for the time input.
Start date selection: %1$s – End date selection: %2$s
Tap to switch to Calendar view
Tap to switch to year view
In order to create and open projects, we need to read and write files to the filesystem. Go to the settings to enable this permission.
Google requires all apps to migrate to a new storage model. We need more storage space to copy your files to the new system.
"The free version gives you 3 layers. Upgrade to Pro for up to %1$s layers at this canvas size."
Upgrade to Pro to unlock this tool and over 40 other tools.
If you enjoy using this app, please take a moment to help us by rating it.
Google requires all apps to migrate to a new storage model to improve storage space and user privacy.
"Don't post blank or duplicate artwork; don't post anything that belongs to someone else."
We will remove content that violates the above guidelines.
"Don't post anything that would be offensive to the public at large; this includes nudity, obscenity, gore, or hate-speech."
We respect your rights as an artist, but we may use posted artwork for promotional or instructional purposes.
Press key combination to set a new shortcut.
Restart the app to fully apply this theme
Your Free Trial ends in %1$s days
All purchasable content has been locked
All content will be unlocked for 7 days. After the trial ends, all purchasable content will be locked.
